thread.title: Boulay nabs CCC rookie-of-week honor for second time
thread.title_full: Boulay nabs CCC rookie-of-week honor for second time

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Boulay nabs CCC rookie-of-week honor for second time
text:
Boulay nabs CCC rookie-of-week honor for second time By Staff | Oct 14, 2015 
Biddeford â€” The hits keep coming for University of New England freshman field hockey player Kersey Boulay. 
Boulay, in her first season playing with the Nor'Easters, has been named the Commonwealth Coast Conference (CCC) rookie of the week for play ending Oct. 11. 
Boulay and the Nor'Easters defensive unit allowed no goals, no penalty corners and eight total shots in 140 minutes as UNE posted an 8-0 win over Nichols College of Dudley, Mass. and a 3-0 win over Roger Williams University of Bristol, R.I. 
She also scored her third goal of the season in the team's win over the Bison. 
It is the second time this season Boulay has earned rookie-of-the-week honors. 
Boulay, a 2015 Mount View High School graduate, was a finalist in 2014 for Miss Maine Field Hockey as a member of the Mustangs.
